translations: n.抢掠，盗窃；冲动；纸张撕裂
v.突然抓取，一把抢过；（非正式）（尤指迅速突然地）抢夺，绑架；抓紧时间做，乘机获得；试图抓住（snatch 的现在分词）

sentences.sentence: The South Pole would be the check point on circuit, snatching the data from space, processing them in computers and relaying them to the rest of the world.
sentences.translation: 南极将是轨迹的检查点，从太空中获取数据，用电脑处理，然后将数据传送到世界其他地方。

sentences.sentence: I am on a hot August afternoon, sitting in a Starbucks that two years ago opened a block away from the Theresa, snatching at memories between sips of high-priced coffee.
sentences.translation: 在八月一个炎热的下午，我坐在一家开张了两年，离特蕾莎只有一个街区远的星巴克里，一边啜饮着高价咖啡，一边回忆往事。

sentences.sentence: In my stupid opinion... Snatching bun is an Olympic game.
sentences.translation: 按照我愚蠢的见解，抢那些包子也应该是奥运会比赛项目。
